column2: Hardware Tech, Net Engineer, Gearhead, Rigger
column4: Allows temporary repair or enhancement, scaling by ability rank (see Special Notes)
column5: Basic Tech, Electronics, CyberTech, Weaponsmith, AV Tech, MED TECH, INT, TECH
column8: 10-level rank structure as per role progression (1–10)
column9: Independent, Nomad packs, Corporate R&D, Fixer networks, Scavenger gangs
column10: Access to workshops, repair bays, salvage yards, special tool caches
column11: Gear burnout, jury rig failures, overwork, corporate espionage, scrounging parts
column12: Completing repairs, inventing devices, modifying equipment, recovering tech
column13: Salvage run, prototype test, hotfix on the run, sabotage, black market upgrade
column14: TECH + relevant skill (e.g., Basic Tech, Electronics, Weaponsmith)
column15: Jury Rig allows a Techie to effect a temporary repair or modification to any device, system, or structure. The fix lasts for 1D6 turns per point of Jury Rig ability, after which the item ceases to function until fully repaired. Cannot be used for permanent fixes, and cannot ""restore"" destroyed items. Edge cases: Cannot duplicate unique, irreplaceable, or exotic systems without access to parts. Interacts with Medtech for medical devices, Netrunner for interface repairs, and Solo for weapons/equipment. Techie can create/modify tools and devices for other roles as long as components and DVs are met. Full description and limitations in Special Ability section.
